The paragraph is discussing the pharmacology of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) receptors after the administration of the drug abecarnil. Abecarnil is described as an anxioselective and anticonvulsant beta-carboline derivative. Anxiety and convulsions are mentioned as conditions that this drug is used to treat.
